Fabian

entry.title: A Practical Guide to Cost Center APIs in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
entry.content:
Introduction

When working with cost center master data in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, we often encounter the need to use different APIs. Depending on the scenario, there can be several options available to integrate, replicate, or maintain cost center data.

At first glance, it may seem straightforward to simply use an API. However, the reality is more complex. cost center provides multiple API options, each designed with its own strengths, limitations, and typical use cases.

This blog post aims to bring more clarity by walking through the different API options available for cost center in the public cloud context. We will start by explaining some core concepts, such as the difference between synchronous and asynchronous APIs, and how to think about inbound and outbound APIs. Later, we will look into the individual technologies and provide guidance on how to choose the right API for your use case.

 

Synchronous vs. Asynchronous APIs

One of the most fundamental distinctions when talking about APIs is whether they are synchronous or asynchronous.

  • Synchronous APIs:
    A synchronous API works like a phone call. You “dial” the API, send a request, and wait for the response. You know immediately whether the operation succeeded or failed. This approach is great for real-time validation, single record maintenance, and interactive applications.
  • Asynchronous APIs:
    An asynchronous API is more like sending a letter or an email. You send the request, and the system processes it in the background. The response may come later, often through a callback, message, or event. This approach is better suited for bulk operations, replication, or integrations where immediate feedback is not required.

In practice, you will often integrate APIs into workflows. A useful guideline is to stick to one type of API in your workflow. Mixing synchronous and asynchronous calls can introduce complexity, especially if you need to coordinate responses.

For example:

  • Starting with an asynchronous request and then immediately relying on a synchronous call without checking status may fail because the data is not yet processed.
  • If you must combine them, always build in the right checks: confirm the asynchronous process is complete before moving to the synchronous step.

Examples: How to work with synchronous/asynchronous APIs

  • If your process needs an instant response, such as validation or single master data change — go for synchronous.
  • If your process deals with large volumes or can wait for processing — asynchronous is usually more efficient.

 

Inbound vs. Outbound APIs

Another useful way of categorizing APIs is to look at whether they are inbound or outbound:

  • Inbound APIs: These are used when an external system wants to send data to an SAP S/4HANA system. In the cost center context, this could mean creating, updating, or deleting cost center master data from an external application.
  • Outbound APIs: These are used when an SAP S/4HANA system sends data or events to an external system. In other words, these APIs “push” information out.

 

Technologies

Working with cost center master data comes with different integration needs, and SAP offers a variety of API technologies to meet them. Each option is designed for specific scenarios and scope items, so choosing the right API depends on your particular requirements. In the sections below, we provide an overview of the key technologies available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud and how they are typically used.

OData V4:

The Cost Center OData V4 service allows you to create, read, update, and delete cost center master data directly in your system. Since it is an inbound, synchronous API, it is designed for real-time interactions where you need immediate feedback on your changes. The service is built on the RESTful ABAP Programming Model (RAP), which ensures it follows modern development principles and supports extensibility. This means you can adapt the data model and business logic to meet your specific requirements without losing compatibility during system upgrades. Typical scenarios for using this API include creating or updating cost centers from external applications or interactive user interfaces, where instant validation and confirmation are important.

🔗 OData V4 cost center API on API Hub

Business Object Extensibility (Steampunk API)

For developers working on SAP BTP (Business Technology Platform), the cost center business object  Steampunk APIs provide another way to interact with cost center master data. These APIs are also inbound and synchronous, making them suitable for real-time updates. 

🔗Steampunk API on API Hub

OData V2 Read APIs

In some cases, you only need read-only access to cost center data.  OData V2 Read APIs  (A2X services ) provide synchronous access to this information, enabling external systems to retrieve data in real time without modifying it. This is useful for reporting, monitoring, or any scenarios where up-to-date cost center information is required for external applications.

🔗OData V2 Read cost center API on API Hub

Business Events

When your goal is to react to changes rather than actively pull data, Business Events are the way to go. These are outbound, meaning S/4HANA pushes notifications to subscribing systems whenever a relevant change occurs. By subscribing to cost center events, a workflow or external application can respond immediately, for example by fetching updated details or triggering additional processes. This event-driven approach is particularly useful for keeping external systems in sync with S/4HANA or automating business processes based on changes in master data.

🔗 Cost center Business Events on API Hub

SOAP API

As the name suggests, this API transfers the request via SOAP protocol. SOAP API CostCentreReplicationBulkRequest_In is an inbound, asynchronous API that can be used for cost center replication into your S/4HANA system. As it is based on asynchronous processing, it is suitable for changes that do not require immediate response. Usage of SOAP APIs in workflows is generally not advised, unless they perform the final operation or an operation that is not prerequisite for a follow-up step.

 🔗 SOAP cost center API on API Hub 

 

How to choose an API that suits you best

While there are many scenarios where you can use cost center APIs. This little breakdown gives you an idea of which technology to use for each case. Whiie various APIs can support certain scenarios, we highlight the ones that offer the best capabilities for the given task.

 

Combining different APIs in a single workflow

Earlier, we have outlined the importance of taking caution when working with different technologies in a single workflow. This is especially true if a synchronous API and an asynchronous API coexist in the same stack. Let’s explore possible scenarios and their potential challenges.

Combining Synchronous and Asynchronous APIs

There are multiple systems that can carry out cost center changes. Each system, when the change or creation happens, sends a request to the consolidation system that collects all changes from all systems in the landscape and consolidates them. Periodically, this system returns the consolidated data to the source systems for replication and sends them also to receiver systems.

  • If this is done on a time basis, for example, the replication is triggered every midnight, there is no significance whether the replication is carried out synchronously or asynchronously.
  • But if there is a condition in place, for example when the replication is triggered after every change request, then the importance of choosing the right technology is essential.

Asynchronous APIs and Their Challenges

If you send a change request via a SOAP API (asynchronous), you would get an immediate response of HTTP status 200, which simply means that the request was accepted, not that the processing is complete. This is often confused as a response to the request being carried out, which is not exactly true. The request was only accepted and (apart from subscription to business event), there is no further notification of a successful completion. It’s important to keep in mind this distinction:

  • If you misinterpret the initial HTTP response as confirmation of successful processing and use it as a trigger for the replication, you could potentially replicate outdated data, as carrying out the change takes time and is dependent on system resources available.
  • It is also unreliable to choose an arbitrary wait time and then follow up with replication.

The only way to ensure proper synchronization is to trigger an additional GET request, verifying you have the expected data in the system. Or you can avoid this hassle by simply carrying out a synchronous request via OData API. Successful response in a synchronous API means that the request is completed in full and the data is processed and persisted. This can safely serve as a trigger condition for your further processing.

Combining APIs and Business Events

Let’s describe a different scenario where a combination of a business event and an OData API provide a more fluid and efficient integration of a simple workflow. When a cost center is changed in a system, the system implicitly triggers a business event. If there is a listener active, other system can receive this signal with a payload and act according to the desired logic. The payload only consists of the key fields, so when the system recognizes this data as necessary for further processing, it may send an OData GET request to the provider system to retrieve the full data set and persist changes.

 

Conclusion

This post provides a clear overview of the various APIs available for managing cost center master data in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. By understanding the differences between synchronous and asynchronous APIs, inbound and outbound communication, and the specific applications of technologies like OData V4, SOAP, and Business Events, you can choose the most suitable option for your integration needs. Using the right API technology thoughtfully can simplify workflows, ensure data accuracy, and optimize system efficiency. With these insights, you are well-prepared to make the most of the capabilities each API offers while avoiding challenges in complex integrations.

entry.title: Re: Outbound delivery - unable NIl pick when not meeting MDQ
entry.content:
SAP designed the minimum delivery quantity logic to ensure that deliveries below a threshold are not processed at all. It does not distinguish between initial creation and later change. So in standard customizing, there’s no switch to say “only check at creation.”

One option is if you set the item category minimum delivery quantity check to A, the system will only issue a warning. At creation, users will see the warning but can still proceed. Later, in VL02N, you can reduce to zero without being blocked.

The other standard way is to use Minimum Delivery Quantity only in Sales Order. If you enforce it there, you can leave the delivery item category without the “B” setting. That way, the delivery can still be reduced to zero later if stock is not available.

Due to some reasons, if both the above two options is not acceptable, then, the only option is to go with custom development Try with USEREXIT_SAVE_DOCUMENT_PREPARE in MV50AFZ1 or BAdI LE_SHP_DELIVERY_PROC. In the code, you can check if the delivery is being created vs. changed (using XVBELN or change indicator) and only enforce the minimum quantity rule at creation

entry.title: Re: Maint plan operstions materials- Sap4hana public clou...
entry.content:
Good day @Egbert_de_Jong 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Maintenance Plan, Manage Maintenance Plans & SAP Build Process Automation for more details.

To summarise, this limitation you are facing is known in S4HPC. The performance issues you see are due to the fact that every material change in a maintenance plan operation triggers full validation such as task lists, calls and object lists. That is why working manually in the Fiori app feels very slow.

In regard to mass deletion, the Maintenance Plan API allows you to create, update and delete operations but only at single record level. There is currently no delivered function that allows you to delete multiple materials in one payload. This is to prevent accidental removal of large sets of maintenance data that could disrupt scheduling.

You have the possibility to:

  • Use Api scription or BTP process automation to automate what you would manually delete one by one.
  • If you have larger volumes, you can also consider building a custom app on BTP which then consumes the API to manage maintenance plans in bulk.
  • If you occasionally do once a year clean ups, I recommend focusing on automation as this will surely save you time.

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Error updating API specification in SAP Build Process Automation Action Project
entry.content:
Hey @WilliamW,

Yes I was able to resolve this issue. This surely seems to be a bug in the product.

To solve this, I had to change the Url path in the destination to end with  /odata/v4/workflow/. This means, the path has to be till the service document or path where the metadata of your CAP service is served. Remember that it has to end with a /. 

Then you don't need to add any path in the Resource Path field.

You may have to recreate any actions etc, in the Action Project or start from scratch as it might complain about some other errors. 

Hope the product team does some better error handling or logs as for developers errors in this tool are a nightmare to figure out.

Regards,

Melwyn

entry.title: Re: Custom field enhancement for task list and order oper...
entry.content:
There are Screen Exit / Customer Subscreen in the relevant function groups:

  • Task List Operations: Function group XCN1 / SAPLCPDO (screens 3000/3100/3300 depending on detail view).
  • Order Operations: Function group SAPLCOVG (operation detail subscreens).

SAP provides customer sub screen areas in these transactions (e.g., in IW31/IW32 for orders, and in IA05/IA06/IA07 for task lists).

You can place your new field on the subscreen and bind it to the appended database field.

For Data flow, implement the corresponding function exits to move data between screen and database:

  • For task lists: EXIT_SAPLCPDO_002 / EXIT_SAPLCPDO_003 (transfer to/from your custom fields).
  • For orders: EXIT_SAPLCOIH_009 or EXIT_SAPLCOIH_010 (depending on header/operation level).

These exits are part of enhancement projects like CNEX0007 / IWO10009.

entry.title: Re: Challenges in Updating Custom Field During PO Creatio...
entry.content:
Hello @ashoktirumalasetti30 

You cannot reliably assign a value to a contract item's custom field using the PO Badi.

In S4 Public Cloud, PO BAdIs such as MM_PUR_S4_PO_MODIFY_ITEM only operate on the PO business object. The open quantity”on a contract is a standard, system-calculated value target minus released, which is updated by the contract release logic after the PO is created, not through a PO writeback to the contract.

Suggested alternative actions

Avoid creating a duplicate Open Quantity field. Use the standard open/remaining quantity from the contract release data in applications or reports.

If you need it for UI or reporting purposes, provide access via analytics using a Custom CDS View that joins contract item and release data or show the default open quantity column in Manage Purchase Contracts.

If you need to show a value during PO creation, calculate it on the PO side by comparing the contract target with the PO quantity, and display it in a custom PO field. However, avoid trying to update the contract through PO BAdIs.

Useful SAP Documentation

PO BAdIs in Public Cloud scope and limits: SAP KBA-3089559 - Use of BAdI MM_PUR_S4_PO_OPEN in Purchase Order

Manage Purchase Contracts app: follow-on PO creation and standard fields in the SAP Fiori Apps Library.

FAQ / Behaviour of Managing Purchase Orders: How PO Logic is Handled in the Cloud - SAP Community FAQ. SAP Community-FAQ for the Manage Purchase Orders App

Let me know if you need further assistance

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Means of Transport Ranking based on Transportation Du...
entry.content:
Dear Venkat,

It is probably because you have assigned the truck MoT for all products hence it is also valid for the material of which you have defined a specific MoT. So you should define the truck MoT only for products that can use it.

You have the help documentation for this flag:

Whether Means of Transport Valid for All Products

Indicates whether the vehicle is valid for all products. If this indicator is set, the vehicle is valid for all products for which there is a product procurement entry. If the vehicle is also assigned to other products, the attributes of the product-specific vehicle are valid. For the products for which there is no product-specific vehicle defined, the system uses the attributes of this vehicle.

If the indicator is not set, products are only valid for the vehicle if a product-specific vehicle has been defined for them.

Best regards,

Cyrille
Application Innovation Services
SAP Development Support

entry.title: Re: Dunning per Mail/Printing only if there is no Mail-Ad...
entry.content:
Hello @FabianSCC

The fact that you are still choosing Default Email Address = is initial remains the reason for the error. This setting does not function as a hard switch to force printing. Instead it still tries to resolve an email channel and fails.

  • I recommend you keep the EMAIL rule in one determination step with Defaut Email Address = is not initial.
  • Define your PRINT rule as a separate determination step without any email condition.  

This way, if an email exists then the first step triggers email. If no email exists then the first step does not apply and the second step triggers print.

This separation ensures that the system avoids trying to evaluate both rules in the same step and solves the error.

Best regards,
Chris

entry.title: Re: Same short desc & Long desc for different material co...
entry.content:
To your question Consultant work or end user work,

End users

  • Can help identify duplicates in day‑to‑day operations (e.g., they notice multiple codes for the same item).
  • Can provide business input on which material is the “right” one to keep.

Consultants / Master Data Team

  • Responsible for the technical cleanup (blocking, deletion flags, stock transfers).
  • Set up preventive controls (exits, BAdIs, governance processes).
  • Guide business on data standards and naming conventions.

it is not possible in SAP standard.

you can try to use the standard enhancement "COPA0003" to define a more flexible way of assigning characteristic groups within individual transactions.

entry.title: Sales_Q&A - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Cloud Live Customers
entry.content:
This is only relevant for Partners and Live Customers who are required to transit Production system data with EUR adoption in Bulgaria. How To Guide Collection - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live Customers

In the 7th session offered by ASC Cloud ERP Expertise Services, the main topic covered is around Sales.

  • Recording - Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Sales_Q&A)
  • Presentation - Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Sales_Q&A)  
  • Accelerator Guide - Sales Implementation Accelerator  

Key Discussion Points‌

‌1. Transition Overview‌

  • New company code and sales organization will be created for Bulgaria’s EUR transition, effective January 2026.
  • Master data (customer, material, pricing) must be extended to the new sales org; transactional data (orders, deliveries) must be recreated.

‌2. Sales Area Impact‌

  • ‌Master Data Updates‌:
    • ‌Customer/Material Master‌: Extend to new sales org via Fiori apps or migration cockpit.
    • ‌Pricing‌: Update condition records with new sales org/currency.
    • ‌BOMs/Customer Hierarchies‌: Migrate using dedicated objects (e.g., "material BOM").
  • ‌Transactional Data‌:
    • ‌Orders/Quotations‌: Close existing documents (set rejection reason) and recreate in new org.
    • ‌Billing Documents‌: Cancel and regenerate with EUR currency.

‌3. Manual Activities‌

  • Output forms, tax conditions, and workflows require updates to reflect EUR currency.
  • Sales orders with billing plans/WBS elements must be manually recreated (no migration tool).

Live Questions & Answers

Topic Area‌

‌Question‌

‌Answer

‌Sales Orders with WBS‌

The sales order can be in various states of delivery and invoicing.  How do you recommend handling the orders for which delivery is already created? We also have bought in and drop shipment/third party procurement scenario. So, there might be PO linked to the SO Item. How to handle sales orders in delivery/invoicing stages or with linked POs?

Reject deliveries and close orders to regenerate in new org. Linked POs must also be reversed.

‌EPPM Projects‌

Migration approach for projects linked to sales orders (cost collection)?

Projects likely need extension to new sales org; consult project line experts for confirmation.

‌Checklist Request‌

Can a procurement-style checklist be provided for sales?

Presenter will add a checklist slide to the session materials.

 Call-to-Action

  • Impacted partners/customers could start transition
  • Final planned session: ad-hoc sessions may follow based on feedback

Please view all content and raise questions with tag #Bulgaria

Hi @mickaelquesnot 

If you want to publish content that was helped/created by GenAI, you must add the user tag  GenAI Assisted Content. For content where it's not possible to add a user tag (e.g., answers), you must include this statement: "GenAI was used to help generate this content." We have edited your answer and added the GenAI-statement as we detected AI-generated content in your post. Thank you for your contribution in the SAP Community!

Regards,

Kavya

entry.title: ‌🇫🇷‌ User Group Convention 2025 France USF
entry.content:
This year marks the 35th anniversary of the USF (SAP User Group France) - a major milestone for one of Europe’s most active SAP user communities. The annual convention will take place in Lyon, bringing together more than 2,500 participants from across industries to exchange ideas, share experiences, and explore SAP solutions.

SAP Localization will be part of the agenda with a dedicated session:

“Implementation of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance with RUBIX Consulting for Rémy Cointreau”
🗓 October 8 at 3:00 PM CET

In this session, we’ll walk through how Rémy Cointreau, a global leader in premium spirits, implemented SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) with support from RUBIX Consulting. It’s a great opportunity to hear about real-world project insights and lessons learned.

There will also be a workshop on e-invoicing, focused more on customer feedback - a chance to hear directly from users about their experiences and challenges.

Whether you're working in localization, compliance, or simply interested in how SAP solutions are being applied in practice, we look forward to seeing you there.

REGISTER NOW

Want to connect with others and learn more about DRC in France? Join the France - SAP Document and Reporting Compliance Work Zone group, where SAP experts share updates and guidance.

entry.title: Re: GLO_LOG_REF1_HD update with standard method
entry.content:
During billing creation, use BAdI SD_BIL_CUSTOMER_DATA → method FILL_VBRK_VBRP. Or the classic user exit USEREXIT_FILL_VBRK_VBRP in include RV60AFZZ. Here you can derive the correct indicator from the sales order, delivery, or custom logic and populate VBRK-GLO_LOG_REF1_HD.
After billing creation, use BAPI_BILLINGDOC_CHANGE (if available in your release) or the update FM SD_BIL_DOCUMENT_UPDATE. This is the safe way to update existing billing documents without direct table updates.

entry.title: Re: CC Rerating behavior when no counter snapshot is pres...
entry.content:
Hello,

Yes you can increase this number by using the setupTool command migration increaseCounterSnapshotCount . Be aware that il will require a server downtime . Be also aware that it will not create data in the past, meaning that you will take advantage of this increase in the future only. 

Regarding your second question, the counter snapshots are computed according to the received events. As you don't have recurring event, you have snapshot for the 40 days before the last usage event. 

Best regards,

Eric F.

entry.title: Cannot Post Goods Receipt (Movement Type 101) against PO using released APIs in S/4HANA Cloud Public
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are implementing a custom Fiori app (RF-style) on S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition where the business requirement is to post a goods receipt (GR) with movement type 101 against a Purchase Order.

What we tried so far:

OData V2 – Material Documents (API_MATERIAL_DOCUMENT_SRV v2)

  • Deep insert with PurchaseOrder, PurchaseOrderItem, MovementType = 101.

  • Result: 400 errors

    Property PURCHASEORDER is not supported for GoodsMovementType 101
    Property DELIVERY is not supported for GoodsMovementType 101

    → Conclusion: In Cloud, 101 is blocked for PO/Delivery fields.

  • OData V2 – Inbound Delivery API (PostGoodsReceipt function import) -yet to try

Call works, but posts all open quantities automatically.

Missing control for:

  • Partial quantity (RQTY input by user)

  • Batch / Storage location override

  • Movement type override

  • Material Document – Create via Communication Scenario SAP_COM_0108

Activated successfully, but again PO-based 101 not allowed.

What we discovered:

According to SAP API Hub and testing:

The only released API that supports partial qty, batch, 101 against PO in Public Cloud is:

OData V4

Service: api_inbound_delivery_gm/srvd_a2x/sap/inbounddeliverygm/0001

Entity:  POST /GoodsMovement

However, when we try to add this service in S/4HC:

We cannot see it in Communication Arrangement list.

Direct metadata call returns 403 Forbidden (UCON blocked).

we would like to get help form you on following points

  • Is api_inbound_delivery_gm (V4) officially released and consumable in Public Cloud?

  • If yes → how do we enable it? (Which Communication Scenario ID? Or via Custom Comm. Scenario?)

  • If no → what is the official supported API to post a PO-based 101 GR with partial qty + batch from an RF/Fiori app?

entry.title: AI Demo Ideas for S/4HANA Public Cloud (2508 TDD) - Finance/Accounting Focus
entry.content:
Hi everyone,
I need some advice from the community.

Our customer's executive has requested an AI-focused demo using SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud edition. The focus should be on Finance/Accounting or cross-functional processes.

Context: Environment: 2508 TDD system
Constraint: Cannot use other products like SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management
Target audience: C-level executives in food manufacturing/retail industry
My scope: Accounting/Finance modules

What I'm looking for:
An "AI-powered" or "next-generation" demo that:

Looks impressive and innovative
Doesn't require extensive setup (realistic prep time)
Can be demonstrated within standard S/4HANA Public Cloud capabilities
Preferably something other than Joule (looking for alternatives!)

Initial thoughts:

Predictive analytics for cash flow?
Intelligent automation in financial closing?
ML-based anomaly detection?

Has anyone successfully demonstrated similar scenarios? What worked well? Any tips on quick wins that showcase AI capabilities effectively?
Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Delegating approvers in SAP Focused Build
entry.content:
Hi SAP,

 

Is there any possibility for Delegating approvers in requirement approval procedures in SAP Focused Build

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Delegating approvers in SAP Focused Build
entry.content:
Hello,

 

Please see Approval Procedures | SAP Help Portal . The substitution functionality could help you achieve what you are looking for.

From the help page:

"You can designate a substitute, who can also approve or reject your requests for change, for example, while you are out of the office. In the WebClient UI, select Maintain Substitute and choose the business partner who is your substitute. Your substitute’s user needs authorization object SM_APP_AP with activity Accept for the specific transaction types.

The system sends a workflow item to the original approver and to the assigned substitute."

 

Best regards, 

 

SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Cannot Post Goods Receipt (Movement Type 101) against...
entry.content:
In Public Cloud, SAP deliberately restricts the Material Document API (OData V2). For movement type 101 against a PO, the fields PurchaseOrder and Delivery are not released → hence the 400 error. This is by design: SAP wants PO-based GRs to flow through the Inbound Delivery process or the released Goods Movement APIs, not through the generic material document service.

The API you mentioned (api_inbound_delivery_gm/srvd_a2x/sap/inbounddeliverygm/0001) is indeed listed on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub and it seems, it is not yet released for Public Edition, or it is only available in Private Cloud / On-Premise editions.

For PO-based 101 GR with partial qty, batch, storage location, you can try with API_INBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV but the standard function import posts all open quantities.

To handle partial qty / batch / storage location, SAP’s guidance is first adjust the inbound delivery items (quantities, batch, storage location) via the Inbound Delivery API (API_INBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV → PATCH/UPDATE on items). Then call PostGoodsReceipt. This way, you control exactly what gets posted. This is the same sequence the standard Fiori apps use (e.g. Post Goods Movement app).

entry.title: Next Generation Just-In-Time, Supply to Customer
entry.content:
The Next Generation JIT Processing solution is now available in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (Supply to Customer).

 JIT Supply to Customer(S2C) allows you to run just-in-time process with your customer for products delivered from stock or manufactured based on JIT requests. You can receive and process delivery schedules with reference to JIT sales scheduling agreements for planning and production purposes and receive summarized or sequenced JIT calls for shipping purposes. The Next Generation JIT S2C provide bellow business value:

  • Supports the basic business process for just-in-time supply
  • Provides efficiency and transparency in processing
  • Helps process the supply efficiently
  • Flexibility through configuration and extensibility

Let’s take the business of automobile industry as an example, JIT S2C solution will be used on the supply business between Component Manufacturer and Vehicle Manufacturer.

There are two types of JIT Call: Summarized JIT Call and Sequenced JIT Call.

Summarized JIT Call is quantity-based or container-based call-offs without vehicle reference.

Sequenced JIT Call is Order-based requests for supply in sequence of production with Vehicle-specific (reference to VIN/production number).

Let’s focus on Sequenced JIT Call and deep dive further.

From the above lifecycle figure of the Sequenced JIT Calls, you can see that:

  • We start the process from manage customer request by creating Customer JIT Calls. Most of the time JIT Calls will be created via EDI, but manually creating JIT Calls also be supported.
  • If you supply to customer with production, you release JIT Calls to production and confirm production with related goods movements posted.
  • After the manufactured products been received to stock, you pack the products and create outbound deliveries. Post goods issue to the outbound deliveries.
  • Create and process billing document from customer.

We support Monitoring JIT Calls by Internal Processing Status like below. You can easily figure out how many JIT Calls are there and which status they are in.

Overall, next-generation JIT processing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition provides a robust framework for managing complex supply chain operations, offering significant advantages in terms of efficiency, flexibility, and transparency.

entry.title: SII tip for Spain #6: Invoices with zero amounts in SII due to full discounts
entry.content:
Welcome to the SII tips for Spain. In this and subsequent short blogs, we will provide different tips on special SII features in relation to the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance solution.

The tip for today is a very recurring topic which I would like to clarify in this post.

Sometimes invoices are issued with a 100% discount, meaning that no amount will be charged to the customer for this business transaction. In these cases, both the tax tax base and the tax amount will be zero, regardless of the applicable VAT rate (21%, 10% or 4%). The recurring question is whether these invoices are to be submitted to the SII or not.

From our understanding of the law:

  • According to the article 164.Uno.3.º of the VAT Law, companies are obliged to issue an invoice for the delivery of goods or services under the business activity, even in the cases of not subject or VAT exempted transactions. 
  • In case the discount if offered after the transaction takes place, the operation has to be documented with a correction invoice (Credit Memo). The article 80 of the VAT law defines the cases by which the tax base amount can be reduced to zero. Basically:
    • Transactions with discounts of 100%
    • Returns of goods.
  • Additionally, according to article 78.Tres.2º of the VAT law, the tax base amount shall not include "discounts and bonuses which are legally justified and which are granted prior to or simultaneously at the time when the transaction is carried out".

The Directorate of Taxes have published a number of binding answers (consultas vinculates) to these regards, for example.  V1423-08 , V0811-16 , V2088-20, V2635-11, V2966-15,  V1691-06 , ...

In summary, a zero amount invoice does not always mean that the transaction is for free, only it means that the receiver is not paying anything. Even by the fact that invoices with zero amount are not causing any financial disruption, they have to be accounted.

In summary, if you issue an invoice with a 100% discount from the Sales and Distribution module (see note 878428), two main things will happen when the billing Item is replicated in accounting : 

  1. An new invoice number will be consumed (for example, via ODN).
  2. The invoice will be submitted to the SII. Keep in mind that SII will allow zero amount invoices from SD only.

 

In case of additional questions, you can visit the SII help documentation in the following links:

  • Electronic Tax Register Books with SII in S/4HANA Public Cloud
  • Electronic Tax Register Books with SII in S/4HANA Private Cloud
  • Electronic Tax Register Books with SII in ERP

Other SII tips:

  • SII tip for Spain #5: SII Adjustments for Canary Islands October 2025

entry.title: Re: Can you remember the first time you heard of SAP
entry.content:
I first heard of SAP during an internship I landed when I was 17. Everyone was talking about SAP with a sense of "love hate" relationship. Everyone was frustrated by the scale and complexity of it, and yet, it was also the best! 

I worked parallel to SAP for many years, and this trend continued. People would say that doing an SAP implementation was the most difficult thing one could do in their career. I think this complexity and nuance is what drew me to SAP, and is continuing to draw me in.

entry.title: Re: Copying Material code to PO
entry.content: For Purchase Requisitions there is a delivered Excel upload template (in My Purchase Requisitions app). As like PR, for Purchase Orders, SAP does not provide a direct Excel upload template in the UI, but you can create PRs in bulk from Excel (via app or API), then convert them to POs. This is the most business‑friendly approach if the requirement is “upload from Excel.”

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Error during the Migration of notes with the Migration Object Customer
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

i have the following issue during the migration of texts in the migration object customer. My goal is to migrate texts for customers in a way, so that it is displayed in the notes section of the customer (compare screenshot). The Text should be of the type "accounting note" (Text-ID: 0002).


What i have done so far is, that i filled the fields for the general texts in the migration template. After that i had to edit the mapping in the migration cockpit. The predefined text object (table) seems to be KNA1 (general business partner data), but when i try to map the Text-ID 0002 i get the following error during the simulation: "Text-ID 0002 is invalid for Object KNA1". But when i go into the Business Partner i can add a note with the Text-ID 0002 without a problem.

For the Source Text-ID used a place holder in the template, so "Buchhaltungsnotiz" = "Accounting note". 

After some research i found out, that the Text-IDs are predefined in the Public Cloud, so in my opinion this could only be a problem of a missing assingment between the Text object and the Text ID, but i cant find any customizing setting to change this for the Business Partner. I have only seen settings for the sales areas etc.

My question is, what is the correct Text-ID for this case when i want to migrate accounting notes into the notes section of the general data view of the customers and if it is 0002, what settings do i need to make so this is allowed during the migration.

Best regards 
Lukas
